groveR 0.2.1

A function to turn vegetation index raster data into a vegetation density raster for further analysis.

Source: R/main.R
veg_dens.Rd

veg_dens takes an annual series of vegetation index rasters and converts them to a vegetation density (cover) product.

veg_dens(irast, rastkey, choice, index, ext, calibration)

Arguments

irast

Character file path to input vegetation index rasters.

rastkey

Character representation of unique string to match in intended rasters. This aids in not selecting additional files generated by other software (e.g. ArcMap).

choice

Character vector of chosen year/s. If all years in a folder are to be processed choice can be "all".

index

Character representation of the index (should be part of the input raster file name) which will be replaced in the new output file name.

ext

Character representation of the desired file type output. Prefer ".img" to avoid missing crs information.

calibration

Character representation of the name of the calibration csv file including file path.

Value

For each input raster a vegetation density raster of the same will be written to file in a folder named `veg_dens/`.

Details

Density to vegetation index relationship must be established through prior analysis and the calibration file will provide the coefficients from this. The calibration file is a simple csv with a value in 5 columns named as follows:

  • coef - the coefficient of the regression

  • intercept - the intercept of the regression

  • multiple - a value to multiply by to bring output to a percentage

  • lower - lower limit of acceptable vegetation density

  • upper - upper limit of acceptable vegetation density

All input rasters should have the same extents and cell size. Whilst it won't affect the performance of this function, downstream processing will fail. See package vignette for full explanation of processing work flow.

Author

Bart Huntley, bart.huntley@dbca.wa.gov.au

Examples

if (FALSE) {
veg_dens(irast = "Z:/DEC/projectXX/mosaics", rastkey = ".ers",
    choice = c("1991", "2010"), index = "ndvi", ext = ".img",
    calibration = "./supplementary/calibration.csv")
    }
